posts.post_content: Don't underestimate this. It's [Glory Seeker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glory Seeker) at first, and it's expensive to level, but it can become [Kor Skyfisher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Skyfisher) and then [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel).

posts.post_content: Why all the hate for levelers? Think of them like creatures with a kicker cost you can pay any time during your turn, and that you can pay with increments. Hell, levelers are in my opinion better than most of the multikicker creatures out there
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Another card strictly better than Gloryseeker. That's not a 0.5 of 5. The p/t bonus seems random. I would have preferred a version when a level up would have included a little drawback as well... but drawback are lame. Right R&D?
posts.html:
Another card strictly better than Gloryseeker. That's not a 0.5 of 5. The p/t bonus seems random. I would have preferred a version when a level up would have included a little drawback as well... but drawback are lame. Right R&D?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Cheza (5/2/2010 3:16:49 PM)
Rating:

@F_fivefiftyseven: There's not a lot of love for multikicker creatures, either.

Seriously, though, I really like the level up concept. I think it makes for interesting card design. Frankly, it's too bad this is the 'last set' mechanic, meaning it won't be expanded upon in future expansions (much like Cascade). I think there's a lot of room for interesting level up design, and I would have liked to see where R&D took it.

Oh, and this guy's expensive because everything in Rise is expensive. Just draft it and have fun.
